insights: N ≡ 3 mod 4, so N must have at least one prime factor ≡ 3 mod 4
This prime cannot be in {p₁,...,pₖ} since each pᵢ divides N+1 but not N
Product of integers ≡ 1 mod 4 stays ≡ 1 mod 4, so N can't factor entirely into 4k+1 primes
This proof is completely elementary - no Dirichlet needed
